body:
Comment 4 by **m.ne@gmx.net**: 
The problem seems to be that hmac has to compute two different hashes. As only one hash
object is used, between the two computations the hash needs to be reset,
http://golang.org/cl/2013044/ is a first stab at the issue by storing the mac
after computation. Having two distinct hash objects might be a more thorough fix, albeit
more intrusive.
